value.name: The Left’s Watered-Down Condemnation of Attacks on Jews
value.description: Over the past two weeks, anyone with access to social media would have come across an endless stream of posts relating to Israel and Gaza, and would have seen examples of wanton attacks by pro-Palestinian mobs against Jews in major cities all across the globe.

video.name: The Left’s Watered-Down Condemnation of Attacks on Jews | National Review

value.name: OPINION: Using COVID-19 to make our cities fairer, greener and healthier
value.description: For more than a year, cities have been on the front lines of the COVID-19 pandemic. As economic hubs, engines of growth and development and lively crossroads, urban centres are often the first places to be exposed to the virus.

value.name: Defense chief: US pullout from Afghanistan ‘slightly’ ahead
value.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin told Congress on Thursday that America’s troop withdrawal from Afghanistan is “slightly” ahead of schedule, but he provided no details.

value.name: George Floyd’s family holds rally, march in brother’s memory
value.description: Members of George Floyd’s family, and others who lost loved ones to police encounters, joined activists and citizens in Minneapolis on Sunday for a march that was one of several events planned nationwide to mark the one-year anniversary of Floyd’s death.

value.name: Families urge legal changes to prevent more police killings
value.description: Parents and siblings of Black men killed by police urged people during a discussion in the city where George Floyd was killed a year ago to join them in pursuing legal changes
